page.title: 09Heathcote Farm
page.content: Heathcote farm lies to the south of Wasperton lane and consists of 630 acres. 400 acres of this is devoted to the corn crops of wheat, oats and barley, while the rest is given over to permanent pasture and hay and silage fields. On the pasture are kept 600 breeding sheep and 300 beef cattle. These are sent to market throughout the year,the majority going to Banbury market although some go to Stratford. The corn is marketed through corn merchants although a great deal usually finds its way to Barford mill where it is converted into animal feed.The farm also raises small flocks of turkeys and geese. The farm employs 3 people the farmer and his son and a farm worker who lives in a cottage on the farm. Casual labour is employed at harvest and lambing and calving times.
